title-part.text: ELECTRIC SOLID-STATE DEVICES NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the periodic system used is the I to VIII group system indicated in the Periodic Table under Note (3) of section C.

title-part.text: Thermoelectric devices comprising a junction of dissimilar materials, i.e. devices exhibiting Seebeck or Peltier effects

reference.text: integrated devices or assemblies of multiple devices H10N19/00

title-part.text: operating with only the Peltier or Seebeck effects
characterised by the heat-exchanging means at the junction
characterised by the structure or configuration of the cell or thermocouple forming the device
the junction being separable, e.g. using a spring
the junction being non-separable, e.g. being cemented, sintered or soldered
comprising compounds containing boron, carbon, oxygen or nitrogen

note.note-paragraph:
Group H10N10/855 is impacted by reclassification into group H10N10/8556.
Groups H10N10/855 and H10N10/8556 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: the compounds being superconducting
comprising compounds containing germanium or silicon

note.note-paragraph:
Group H10N10/8556 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group H10N10/855.
Groups H10N10/855 and H10N10/8556 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: comprising compositions changing continuously or discontinuously inside the material
Thermoelectric devices without a junction of dissimilar materials
Thermomagnetic devices, e.g. using the Nernst-Ettingshausen effect

reference.text: integrated devices or assemblies of multiple devices H10N19/00

title-part.text: Thermoelectric devices using thermal change of the dielectric constant, e.g. working above and below the Curie point

CPC-specific-text.text: Thermoelectric active materials

title-part.text: Thermomagnetic devices using thermal change of the magnetic permeability, e.g. working above and below the Curie point
Integrated devices, or assemblies of multiple devices, comprising at least one thermoelectric or thermomagnetic element covered by groups H10N10/00 - H10N15/00

Group H10N19/00 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups H01L25/04, H01L25/065, H01L25/0652, H01L25/0655, H01L25/0657, H01L25/16, H01L25/162, H01L25/165, H01L25/167 and H01L25/18.

reference.text: integrated devices or assemblies of multiple devices H10N39/00

note.note-paragraph:
Group H10N30/00 is impacted by reclassification into group H10N35/00.
Groups H10N30/00 and H10N35/00 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Assembling devices that include piezoelectric or electrostrictive parts
Treatments to modify a piezoelectric or electrostrictive property, e.g. polarisation characteristics, vibration characteristics or mode tuning
Manufacture of multilayered piezoelectric or electrostrictive devices, or parts thereof, e.g. by stacking piezoelectric bodies and electrodes
by integrally sintering piezoelectric or electrostrictive bodies and electrodes
by stacking bulk piezoelectric or electrostrictive bodies and electrodes
Forming electrodes or interconnections, e.g. leads or terminals
Forming interconnections, e.g. connection electrodes of multilayered piezoelectric or electrostrictive parts
Forming single-layered electrodes of multilayered piezoelectric or electrostrictive parts
Forming of piezoelectric or electrostrictive parts or bodies on an electrical element or another base
Mounting of piezoelectric or electrostrictive parts together with semiconductor elements, or other circuit elements, on a common substrate
by laminating or bonding of piezoelectric or electrostrictive bodies
by fusion of metals or by adhesives
by depositing piezoelectric or electrostrictive layers, e.g. aerosol or screen printing
using intermediate layers, e.g. for growth control
Shaping or machining of piezoelectric or electrostrictive bodies
by coating or depositing using masks, e.g. lift-off

CPC-specific-text.text: with electrical and mechanical input and output, e.g. having combined actuator and sensor parts

title-part.text: with electrical input and mechanical output, e.g. functioning as actuators or vibrators

CPC-specific-text.text: using longitudinal or thickness displacement combined with bending, shear or torsion displacement
having polygonal or rectangular shape
having cylindrical or annular shape
using bending displacement, e.g. unimorph, bimorph or multimorph cantilever or membrane benders
Beam type
Cantilevers, i.e. having one fixed end
connected at their free ends, e.g. parallelogram type
having multiple segments mechanically connected in series, e.g. zig-zag type
adapted for in-plane bending displacement
adapted for multi-directional bending displacement
Membrane type
having non-planar shape
using only longitudinal or thickness displacement, e.g. d33 or d31 type devices
using shear or torsion displacement, e.g. d15 type devices

title-part.text: with mechanical input and electrical output, e.g. functioning as generators or sensors

CPC-specific-text.text: Sensors
Beam type
Cantilevers
Membrane type

title-part.text: with electrical input and electrical output, e.g. functioning as transformers
having a stacked or multilayer structure

CPC-specific-text.text: having a non-rectangular cross-section in a plane parallel to the stacking direction, e.g. polygonal or trapezoidal in side view
having a non-rectangular cross-section in a plane orthogonal to the stacking direction, e.g. polygonal or circular in top view
the cross-section being annular
having a cylindrical shape and having stacking in the radial direction, e.g. coaxial or spiral type rolls
adapted for alleviating internal stress, e.g. cracking control layers
based on piezoelectric or electrostrictive fibres
based on piezoelectric or electrostrictive films or coatings
characterised by the underlying bases, e.g. substrates
Intermediate layers, e.g. barrier, adhesion or growth control buffer layers

Group H10N30/80 is impacted by reclassification into group H10N35/80.

for piezoelectric transformers

Lead-zirconium titanate [PZT] based
Bismuth-based oxides

title-part.text: Electrodes or interconnections, e.g. leads or terminals

CPC-specific-text.text: Single-layered electrodes of multilayer piezoelectric or electrostrictive devices, e.g. internal electrodes
Interconnections, e.g. connection electrodes of multilayer piezoelectric or electrostrictive devices
embedded within piezoelectric or electrostrictive material, e.g. via connections
Further connection or lead arrangements, e.g. flexible wiring boards, terminal pins
Conductive materials
the principal material being non-metallic, e.g. oxide or carbon based
Additional insulation means preventing electrical, physical or chemical damage, e.g. protective coatings
Additional mechanical prestressing means, e.g. springs

reference.text: integrated devices or assemblies of multiple devices H10N69/00

CPC-specific-text.text: of composite superconductor filaments
of devices comprising Nb or an alloy of Nb with one or more of the elements of group IVB, e.g. titanium, zirconium or hafnium
of devices comprising intermetallic compounds of type A-15, e.g. Nb3Sn
of devices comprising molybdenum chalcogenides
of devices comprising nitrides or carbonitrides
of devices comprising copper oxide
Processes for depositing or forming copper oxide superconductor layers
from a solution
from a suspension or slurry, e.g. screen printing or doctor blade casting
by evaporation, e.g. MBE
by sputtering
by chemical vapour deposition [CVD]
by metalloorganic chemical vapour deposition [MOCVD]
by thermal spraying, e.g. plasma deposition
by pulsed laser deposition, e.g. laser sputtering
by deposition and subsequent treatment, e.g. oxidation of pre-deposited material
characterised by the substrate
Monocrystalline substrates, e.g. epitaxial growth
Intermediate layers, e.g. for growth control
Processes performed after copper oxide formation, e.g. patterning
Etching
Passivating
Manufacture or deposition of electrodes
Processes including the use of non-gaseous precursors
Manufacture or treatment of filaments or composite wires
Introducing flux pinning centres
of devices comprising metal borides, e.g. MgB2
Treatment of superconductor layers by irradiation, e.g. ion-beam, electron-beam, laser beam or X-rays
of Josephson-effect devices
comprising high-Tc ceramic materials
Single-electron tunnelling devices
comprising high-Tc ceramic materials
comprising metal borides, e.g. MgB2
having three or more electrodes, e.g. transistor-like structures
comprising metal borides, e.g. MgB2
comprising high-Tc ceramic materials
having three or more electrodes, e.g. transistor-like structures
Field effect devices
based on Abrikosov vortices

title-part.text: Solid-state devices having no potential barriers, and specially adapted for rectifying, amplifying, oscillating or switching

reference.text: integrated devices or assemblies of multiple devices H10N79/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Manufacture or treatment of multistable switching devices
Formation of switching materials, e.g. deposition of layers
by chemical vapor deposition, e.g. MOCVD, ALD
by physical vapor deposition, e.g. sputtering
by conversion of electrode material, e.g. oxidation
Modification of switching materials after formation, e.g. doping
by implantation
by diffusion, e.g. photo-dissolution
Shaping switching materials
by etching of pre-deposited switching material layers, e.g. lithography
by filling of openings, e.g. damascene method
by processes specially adapted for achieving sub-lithographic dimensions, e.g. using spacers
Charge density wave transport devices
based on solid-state phase change, e.g. between amorphous and crystalline phases, Ovshinsky effect
between different crystalline phases, e.g. cubic and hexagonal
based on migration or redistribution of ionic species, e.g. anions, vacancies
the species being metal cations, e.g. programmable metallization cells
based on bulk electronic defects, e.g. trapping of electrons
having three or more electrodes, e.g. transistor-like devices
having switching assisted by radiation or particle beam, e.g. optically controlled devices
Constructional details of multistable switching devices
Device geometry
adapted for essentially horizontal current flow, e.g. bridge type devices
adapted for essentially vertical current flow, e.g. sandwich or pillar type devices
on sidewalls of dielectric structures, e.g. mesa-shaped or cup-shaped devices
Current flow limiting means within the switching material region, e.g. constrictions
Electrodes
adapted for resistive heating
adapted for supplying ionic species
adapted for focusing electric field or current, e.g. tip-shaped
Thermal details
Heating or cooling means other than resistive heating electrodes, e.g. heater in parallel
Thermal insulation means
Switching materials
Compounds of sulfur, selenium or tellurium, e.g. chalcogenides
Sulfides, e.g. CuS
Selenides, e.g. GeSe
Tellurides, e.g. GeSbTe
Oxides or nitrides
Binary metal oxides, e.g. TaOx
Complex metal oxides, e.g. perovskites, spinels
based on at least one element of group IIIA, IVA or VA, e.g. elemental or compound semiconductors
